Class TestingBase

java.lang.Object
education.the_software_toolsmith.testing.framework.TestingBase
Direct Known Subclasses:
JUnitTestingBase, TestClassDMRTests
public class TestingBase extends Object
Base class for unit testing
Version:
1.0 2018-05-25 initial set of tests
, 1.1 2018-06-09 revise structure to use TestInfo instead of certain hard-coded text, 1.2 2018-09-02 add timeouts, 1.3 2019-01-14 more implementation, 1.3.1 2019-01-17 cosmetic changes, 2.0 2019-05-12
  • restructure tests
  • disable System.exit() during testing
  • start making each subtest independent so they'll all run even if one fails
, 2.1 2019-05-17
  • rename class
  • remove unnecessary throws clauses from @BeforeXxx and @AfterXxx
  • more fully utilize JUnit 5.4 features
  • switch tests to data-driven
, 3.0 2019-06-27
  • complete re-write with reusable testing infrastructure
  • tests are now data-driven
  • add summary test results
, 3.1 2019-06-28 move detailed activity to log file, 4.0 2019-07-04 split general purpose utilities methods into separate class, 5.0 2019-10-07 revise for Stack ADT, 5.1 2020-01-26 cleanup toward DRCo coding standard compliance, 5.2 2020-05-14
  • cleanup comments
  • enhance null argument handling
  • in parseArguments(): correct numeric range bounds parsing; add support for data-supplied step, repeating group count, duplicate count
  • output formatting adjustments to improve alignment and readability
  • add PlaceholderException to support specific Exception detection
  • add support for detection and display of boolean/Boolean and char/Character types
, 5.3 2020-06-03 add startTest() pass-through for backward compatibility, 5.4 2020-07-22
  • add instance field retrieval and modification methods
  • add method invocation support
, 5.5 2020-08-07
  • consolidate/simplify field access methods
  • add collection retrieval methods
, 6.0 2020-09-13 Split into general unit testing support and JUnit-specific support - this class implements the former., 6.1 2021-04-11 Repackage as canned utility testing suite, 6.2 2021-05-01 in determineStubBehavior(), reset stub behavior indicator when isStubBehavior is false, 6.3 2021-05-01 change stub behavior tracking to only count methods marked as matching stub behavior if they pass, 6.4 2021-06-19
  • remove dependencies upon JUnit
  • remove testinfo parameter to startTest()
  • switch to fully object-oriented (eliminate static variables)
, 6.5 2021-06-23
  • add enableExit() and disableExit()
  • start implementation of auto-determination of test package and class
  • add closeLog()
  • add findFiles()
, 6.6 2021-08-06 start to add superclass support, 6.7 2021-08-08 more superclass support, 6.8 2021-11-18 enhance stub behavior determination, 6.8 2022-04-25 cosmetic fix to message when enabling debugging, 6.9 2022-10-11 modify log file naming, 6.10 2023-02-22 modify log file naming, 7.0 2023-10-19 make changes to not use the SecurityManager if running under Java 17 or later - it's deprecated
Note: this is a stop-gap implementation until the SM is removed, 7.1 2024-02-24 complete updates for deprecation of SecurityManager, 7.2 2024-09-18
  • fully remove security manager references
    Note:
    • we're far enough removed from Java 16 and prior that we don't expect to run there
    • if we do, we simply won't intercept System.exit()
  • replace security manager code with placeholder comments in case an alternate mechanism becomes available to intercept System.exit()
  • remove now unnecessary imports
, 7.3 2025-03-17 track method renaming in TestData.java, 7.3.1 2025-03-18 minor cosmetic change to configuration display to track with newer tests (LListDMRTests), 7.3.2 2025-07-18
  • swap operands to '==' and '!=' when comparing against a constant so the constant is the left operand
  • reorder methods
Author:
David M Rosenberg

    detailedLogStream
    for test 'full' logging

    lastTestInGroupIsRunning
    flag that the last test in a test group is executing
    protected int
    nonStubTestsPassed
    counter for the number of non-stub method behavior tests within a test group that passed
    protected final Object
    savedSecurityManager
    saves the active security manager when testing starts
    will be a reference to an instance of SecurityManager
    changed to Object reference for clean compilation since SecurityManager is deprecated in Java 17
    protected int
    stubBehaviorSeenCount
    counter for the number of tests within a test group that match the expected stubbed method behavior
    protected String
    stubBehaviorTag
    text appended to individual test id for tests that match the expected stubbed method behavior
    protected List<String>
    summaryTestResults
    accumulates test results for summary display once all tests finish

    effectively disable timeout for debugging

    • savedSecurityManager

      protected final Object savedSecurityManager
      saves the active security manager when testing starts
      will be a reference to an instance of SecurityManager
      changed to Object reference for clean compilation since SecurityManager is deprecated in Java 17

      NOTE as of 7.2 this is a noop/placeholder

    • TestingBase

      protected TestingBase()
      convenience constructor for 'well-formed' test drivers

      protected TestingBase(String specifiedTestClassPackageName, String specifiedTestClassSimpleName)
      Parameters:
      specifiedTestClassPackageName - the name of the package in which specifiedTestClassSimpleName exists
      specifiedTestClassSimpleName - the simple name of the class under test

  • Method Details

    • closeLog

      public void closeLog()
      Close the detailed log file - flushes buffered output

    • disableDebugging

      public boolean disableDebugging()
      Disable debugging mode by enabling test timeouts
      Returns:
      true if debugging was previously enabled, false otherwise

    • disableExit

      protected void disableExit()
      Disable System.exit()
      SecurityManager is deprecated as of Java 17

      NOTE as of 7.2 this is a noop

    • enableDebugging

      public boolean enableDebugging()
      Enable debugging mode by suppressing test timeouts
      Returns:
      true if debugging was previously enabled, false otherwise

    • enableExit

      protected void enableExit()
      Re-enable System.exit()
      SecurityManager is deprecated as of Java 17

      NOTE as of 7.2 this is a noop

    • determineStubBehavior

      protected void determineStubBehavior(boolean isStubBehavior)
      Handle stub behavior using default indicator
      Parameters:
      isStubBehavior - flag to indicate that the result of testing this dataset matches

    • determineStubBehavior

      protected void determineStubBehavior(boolean isStubBehavior, String stubBehaviorIndicator)
      Handle stub behavior indicator
      Parameters:
      isStubBehavior - flag to indicate that the result of testing this dataset matches
      stubBehaviorIndicator - text to flag that the current test data matches the expected behavior from stubbed methods

    • findFiles

      public static List<Path> findFiles(String lookFor)
      Locate all instances of the given file in the current project (starting in the current working directory)
      Parameters:
      lookFor - the name of the file to look for
      Returns:
      a list of all matching paths

    • findFiles

      public static List<Path> findFiles(String lookFor, String startIn)
      Locate all instances of the given file in the specified directory tree
      Parameters:
      lookFor - the name of the file to look for
      startIn - root of the directory tree to search
      Returns:
      a list of all matching paths

    • parseArguments

      protected static Object[] parseArguments(String arguments)
      Utility to parse a string of arguments into an array of corresponding entries - for parameterized tests
      Parameters:
      arguments - the string to parse
      Returns:
      an array containing Longs or Strings or a zero-length array of Objects representing the entries in arguments or null if arguments is null

    • setDebug

      protected boolean setDebug(boolean wantToDebug)
      Enable or disable debugging by adjusting test timeouts.
      Parameters:
      wantToDebug - true disables test timeouts; false (default) enables timeouts.
      Returns:
      true if debugging was previously enabled, false otherwise

    • startTest

      protected Object[][] startTest(boolean isLastTest, boolean isStubBehavior, String... collectionContentsArguments)
      Utility to pre-process test parameters - pass-through to method that takes argument labels - for backward compatibility.
      Parameters:
      isLastTest - flag to indicate that this is the last dataset for this test
      isStubBehavior - flag to indicate that the result of testing this dataset matches the stubbed behavior
      collectionContentsArguments - contents of one or more collections to populate
      Returns:
      the parsed collectionContentsArguments in order of appearance in the argument list

    • startTest

      protected Object[][] startTest(boolean isLastTest, boolean isStubBehavior, String[] argumentLabels, String... collectionContentsArguments)
      Utility to pre-process test parameters
      Parameters:
      isLastTest - flag to indicate that this is the last dataset for this test
      isStubBehavior - flag to indicate that the result of testing this dataset matches the stubbed behavior
      argumentLabels - descriptive text for each of the collectionContentArguments elements
      collectionContentsArguments - contents of one or more collections to populate
      Returns:
      the parsed collectionContentsArguments in order of appearance in the argument list

    • testFailed

      protected void testFailed()
      Utility method to perform steps to conclude an unsuccessful test

    • testPassed

      protected void testPassed()
      Utility method to perform steps to conclude a successful test

      parameters - to printf()

    • writeSyserr

      public static void writeSyserr(String format, Object... parameters)
      Print a formatted message to System.err in its proper sequence wrt System.out - limited effectiveness when running multiple threads
      Parameters:
      format - to printf()
      parameters - to printf()
